issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

fields.summary: Upgrade JUnit 3 test cases to JUnit 4

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

issuetype.description: A new unit, integration or system test.
issuetype.name: Test

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

comments.body:
Thanks for the patch, [~ajayydv]. 

I noticed that this test exists in multiple places; o.a.h.mapred and o.a.h.mapreduce.lib.output. I'm not sure I see the point in this teardown method, but if we are fixing it, any reason we wouldn't want to fix both tests (or eliminate one?).

Yes. We need to fix both.
